storyTitle: As Scheduling Manager, I want to edit employee schedules to update shift assignments

testCases.title: Edit schedule to update employee assignment successfully
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduling Manager with edit permissions
At least one schedule exists with assigned shifts
Multiple employees are available in the system
No existing conflicts for the target employee
Audit logging system is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view loads successfully displaying all existing schedules and shifts

steps.action: Select a specific shift from the schedule that needs to be edited
steps.expectedResult: Shift details are displayed including current employee assignment, time, date, and role requirements

steps.action: Click on the edit button or employee assignment field for the selected shift
steps.expectedResult: Edit mode is activated and employee selection dropdown or input field becomes available

steps.action: Change the employee assignment by selecting a different valid employee from the available list
steps.expectedResult: New employee is selected, input is accepted without errors, and no validation warnings appear

steps.action: Review the updated assignment details to ensure accuracy
steps.expectedResult: Updated shift shows new employee assignment with correct shift time and role information

steps.action: Click the Save button to commit the updated schedule
steps.expectedResult: System processes the update within 2 seconds, displays success confirmation message, schedule is updated in the view, and audit log entry is created with timestamp, manager ID, and change details

postconditions: Schedule is updated with new employee assignment
Audit log contains entry documenting the change
Previous employee is unassigned from the shift
New employee is assigned to the shift
No schedule conflicts exist
Confirmation message is displayed to the manager

testCases.title: Reject schedule update with conflicting employee assignment
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduling Manager with edit permissions
At least one schedule exists with assigned shifts
An employee is already assigned to an overlapping shift
Validation rules for conflict detection are configured
System conflict detection is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view and select a shift to edit
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view loads and shift details are displayed for editing

steps.action: Attempt to assign an employee who is already scheduled for an overlapping time slot
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays a validation error message indicating the employee has an overlapping shift assignment with specific time details

steps.action: Review the error message and conflict details
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly identifies the conflicting shift, time overlap, and affected employee

steps.action: Attempt to click the Save button while the conflict exists
steps.expectedResult: Save operation is blocked, error message persists or is re-displayed, and no changes are committed to the schedule

steps.action: Verify that the original schedule remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Original employee assignment is still in place and no audit log entry is created for the failed update attempt

postconditions: Schedule remains unchanged with original employee assignment
No audit log entry is created for the rejected change
Validation error message is visible to the manager
Employee conflict is not created in the system
Manager can continue editing to resolve the conflict

storyTitle: As Scheduling Manager, I want to process shift swap requests to accommodate employee needs

testCases.title: Approve valid shift swap request
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduling Manager with swap approval permissions
Two employees are scheduled for different shifts
Both employees have compatible roles for each other's shifts
No scheduling conflicts exist for either employee
Notification system is operational
Shift swap request workflow is enabled

steps.action: Employee A submits a shift swap request with Employee B through the employee portal
steps.expectedResult: Shift swap request is successfully recorded in the system with status 'Pending', request ID is generated, and both employees' shift details are captured

steps.action: Manager navigates to the shift swap requests queue or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Shift swap requests page loads displaying all pending requests including the newly submitted swap request with employee names, shift details, and submission timestamp

steps.action: Manager selects and opens the specific shift swap request to review details
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed showing both employees, their current shifts, proposed swap details, shift times, dates, and role requirements

steps.action: Manager validates the swap feasibility by reviewing employee availability and shift compatibility
steps.expectedResult: System shows validation status indicating no conflicts, compatible roles, and both employees are available for the swapped shifts

steps.action: Manager clicks the Approve button to approve the shift swap request
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated to 'Approved' within 2 seconds, confirmation message is displayed to the manager

steps.action: System automatically updates the schedules for both employees
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is now assigned to Employee B's original shift, Employee B is assigned to Employee A's original shift, schedules reflect the changes immediately

steps.action: System sends notifications to both affected employees
steps.expectedResult: Both Employee A and Employee B receive notifications confirming the approved shift swap with updated shift details and dates

postconditions: Shift swap request status is 'Approved'
Schedules are updated with swapped shift assignments
Both employees have received approval notifications
Audit trail records the swap approval with manager ID and timestamp
No scheduling conflicts exist
Original shifts are reassigned correctly

testCases.title: Reject invalid shift swap request
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduling Manager with swap approval permissions
Two employees are scheduled for shifts
Shifts have incompatible role requirements or timing conflicts
Validation rules for shift compatibility are configured
Notification system is operational

steps.action: Employee submits a shift swap request for shifts with incompatible requirements (e.g., different roles, overlapping times, or qualification mismatches)
steps.expectedResult: Shift swap request is recorded in the system with status 'Pending' and request details are captured including the incompatible shift information

steps.action: Manager navigates to the shift swap requests queue and selects the invalid swap request
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed showing both employees and their shift information

steps.action: Manager reviews the request and attempts to click the Approve button
steps.expectedResult: System validates the swap feasibility and blocks the approval action, displaying a validation error message indicating the specific incompatibility (e.g., 'Employee B does not have required certification for Shift A' or 'Shifts have incompatible time slots')

steps.action: Manager reviews the validation error details
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly explains why the swap cannot be approved with specific details about the incompatibility

steps.action: Manager clicks the Reject button to formally reject the swap request
steps.expectedResult: Request status is updated to 'Rejected' within 2 seconds, rejection is confirmed with a success message to the manager

steps.action: System sends rejection notifications to the requesting employees
steps.expectedResult: Both employees receive notifications indicating the shift swap request has been rejected with reason for rejection included

steps.action: Verify that the original schedules remain unchanged
steps.expectedResult: Both employees remain assigned to their original shifts with no modifications to the schedule

postconditions: Shift swap request status is 'Rejected'
Original schedules remain unchanged for both employees
Both employees have received rejection notifications with reasons
Audit trail records the rejection with manager ID and timestamp
No invalid shift assignments are created
System maintains schedule integrity

storyTitle: As Scheduling Manager, I want to cancel shifts to handle unforeseen changes

testCases.title: Cancel scheduled shift successfully
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduling Manager with cancellation permissions
At least one scheduled shift exists in the system
Shift has at least one employee assigned
Employee has valid email address and notification preferences enabled
System notification service is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management page and locate a scheduled shift
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management page loads successfully with list of scheduled shifts displayed

steps.action: Select a scheduled shift for cancellation by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Shift details are displayed including shift date, time, assigned employees, and location information

steps.action: Click the 'Cancel Shift' button
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking to confirm the cancellation action

steps.action: Review the cancellation details and click 'Confirm' button
steps.expectedResult: Shift is removed from the schedule, success confirmation message is displayed, and cancellation is processed within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the shift no longer appears in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Cancelled shift is not visible in the schedule and the time slot shows as available

steps.action: Check the notification log or verify with affected employees that notifications were sent
steps.expectedResult: Notifications are delivered successfully to all affected employees via their preferred channels (email and/or system alerts)

steps.action: Verify notification delivery status in the system logs
steps.expectedResult: System logs show 100% notification delivery success for all affected employees

postconditions: Shift is permanently removed from the schedule
All affected employees have received cancellation notifications
Schedule is updated and reflects the cancellation
Notification delivery is logged in the system
Time slot is available for new scheduling

testCases.title: Prevent cancellation without confirmation
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduling Manager with cancellation permissions
At least one scheduled shift exists in the system
Shift has at least one employee assigned

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management page loads successfully with list of scheduled shifts displayed

steps.action: Select a scheduled shift for cancellation by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Shift details are displayed with cancellation option available

steps.action: Click the 'Cancel Shift' button
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog is displayed with options to confirm or dismiss the cancellation, including warning message about the impact

steps.action: Click 'Cancel', 'Dismiss', or 'X' button on the confirmation dialog without confirming
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog closes and returns to the shift details view

steps.action: Verify the shift still appears in the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Shift remains scheduled with all original details intact and no changes made

steps.action: Check that no notifications were sent to employees
steps.expectedResult: No cancellation notifications are sent and notification logs show no new entries for this shift

postconditions: Shift remains in the schedule unchanged
No notifications sent to employees
No updates made to the schedule
Cancellation action is aborted successfully

storyTitle: As Scheduling Manager, I want to receive notifications about schedule changes to stay informed

testCases.title: Receive notification on schedule creation
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduling Manager
At least one employee exists in the system with valid email address
Employee notification preferences are enabled for schedule creation events
Notification service is operational and configured
Email service is functional

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads successfully with all required fields displayed

steps.action: Fill in all required schedule details including date, time, location, and assign at least one employee
steps.expectedResult: All fields accept input and employee is successfully assigned to the schedule

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Create Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Wait up to 1 minute and check the assigned employee's email inbox
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received by the assigned employee containing schedule details within 1 minute

steps.action: Check the system alerts/notifications panel for the assigned employee
steps.expectedResult: System alert notification is displayed in the employee's notification panel with schedule creation details

steps.action: Navigate to the notification logs in the system administration panel
steps.expectedResult: Notification delivery is logged in the system with timestamp, recipient, delivery method, and status

steps.action: Verify the notification log shows successful delivery without errors
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows 'Success' status with no error messages for both email and system alert delivery

postconditions: Schedule is created and saved in the system
Notifications delivered via both email and system alerts
Notification delivery logged with success status
99% notification delivery success rate maintained
All assigned employees are informed of the new schedule

testCases.title: Configure and receive notifications based on preferences
preconditions: User is logged in as an employee or manager
User has access to notification preferences settings
At least one schedule exists that can be modified
User is assigned to at least one schedule
Notification service is operational

steps.action: Navigate to user profile or settings page
steps.expectedResult: User settings page loads successfully with notification preferences section visible

steps.action: Locate and click on 'Notification Preferences' or 'Notification Settings'
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences page displays with options for email, system alerts, and event types

steps.action: Update notification preferences by selecting or deselecting specific channels (e.g., enable email only, disable system alerts) and event types
steps.expectedResult: Preference checkboxes or toggles respond to user input and show updated selections

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed confirming preferences have been saved successfully

steps.action: As a Scheduling Manager, navigate to an existing schedule assigned to the user and modify it (change time, date, or location)
steps.expectedResult: Schedule modification is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Wait up to 1 minute and check if notifications are sent according to the updated preferences
steps.expectedResult: Notifications are sent only through the channels enabled in preferences (e.g., email only if system alerts were disabled)

steps.action: Verify that disabled notification channels did not send notifications
steps.expectedResult: No notifications received through disabled channels, confirming preferences are respected

steps.action: Check notification logs to verify delivery matches user preferences
steps.expectedResult: Notification logs show delivery attempts only for enabled channels with appropriate success status

postconditions: User notification preferences are updated and saved
Notifications are sent according to updated preferences
Disabled notification channels do not send notifications
Notification delivery is logged correctly
User receives notifications only through preferred channels

storyTitle: As Scheduling Manager, I want to view reports on schedule utilization to optimize workforce planning

testCases.title: Generate schedule utilization report with valid parameters
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduling Manager role
User has authorization to access reporting section
At least one department exists in the system
Schedule data exists for the selected date range
Employee and shift template data is available in the database

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting section from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Reporting UI is displayed with available report types and parameter selection options

steps.action: Select 'Schedule Utilization' report type from the dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Schedule utilization report parameters form is displayed

steps.action: Select a valid date range (e.g., last 30 days) using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date range is populated in the form fields and validated as correct format

steps.action: Select a department from the department dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: Department is selected and displayed in the parameter form

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and displays a loading indicator

steps.action: Wait for report generation to complete
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed within 5 seconds showing shift coverage statistics, employee scheduled hours, and schedule adherence data with accurate information matching the selected parameters

steps.action: Verify report contains shift coverage statistics section
steps.expectedResult: Shift coverage statistics are displayed with percentage coverage, total shifts, and filled/unfilled shift counts

steps.action: Verify report contains employee scheduled hours section
steps.expectedResult: Employee scheduled hours are displayed with individual employee names, total hours, and breakdown by shift type

postconditions: Report is successfully generated and displayed on screen
Report data matches the selected parameters
System logs the report generation activity
Report remains accessible for export or further analysis

testCases.title: Export schedule utilization report
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduling Manager role
User has authorization to access reporting section
User has successfully navigated to the reporting section
Schedule utilization report has been generated with valid parameters
Report data is displayed on screen
User has appropriate file download permissions in browser

steps.action: Navigate to reporting section and select report parameters (date range and department)
steps.expectedResult: Report parameters are accepted and form is ready for generation

steps.action: Click 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report is displayed on screen with shift coverage statistics, employee hours, and all relevant data within 5 seconds

steps.action: Verify export options are available on the report interface
steps.expectedResult: Export buttons for PDF and Excel formats are visible and enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Export as PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: System initiates PDF generation and download process

steps.action: Wait for PDF download to complete and open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is successfully downloaded with a meaningful filename (e.g., ScheduleUtilization_Department_DateRange.pdf) and opens correctly showing all report data including headers, shift coverage statistics, employee hours, and formatting preserved

steps.action: Verify PDF content matches the on-screen report data
steps.expectedResult: All data in PDF matches the displayed report including numbers, employee names, dates, and statistics with proper formatting and readability

steps.action: Return to the report interface and click the 'Export as Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: System initiates Excel file generation and download process

steps.action: Wait for Excel download to complete and open the downloaded Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is successfully downloaded with a meaningful filename (e.g., ScheduleUtilization_Department_DateRange.xlsx) and opens correctly in spreadsheet application

steps.action: Verify Excel content matches the on-screen report data
steps.expectedResult: All data in Excel matches the displayed report with proper column headers, data in appropriate cells, numbers formatted correctly, and data is editable/manipulable in Excel

steps.action: Verify Excel file structure includes separate sheets or sections for different report components
steps.expectedResult: Excel file contains organized data with shift coverage statistics and employee hours clearly separated and labeled

postconditions: PDF file is successfully downloaded and contains accurate report data
Excel file is successfully downloaded and contains accurate report data
Both exported files match the on-screen report content
Files are saved to the user's default download location
System logs the export activities
Original report remains displayed on screen for further analysis
